USA Cycling Collecting data in background Running DISABLED Service Status: Device Status: Device Type: Device Name: Device connection: Device Number: IOT connection status: NOT_CONNECTED Unhandled Exception Searching for devices … My devices Please wait … Connecting to IOT EXIT
/* menu items */ Scan for devices Show statistics Set BPM power refresh show favourite devices Add to my devices Remove from my devices Rename device New scan Statistics Settings Disconnect Rename device Please, input new name Total messages count Data messages count Status messages lost Data messages lost Total messages lost Status messages delivered Data messages delivered Total messages delivered Status messeges count ConfigureBPMActivity IoT connection settings Select device ID MQTT settings Power meters settings SAVE EXIT SETTINGS Custom credentials Input ID Input token Data message QoS Status message QoS Power meter settings Make sure that all power meters are paired and running Rotate the power meters at least one revolution to ensure they are awake and ready to communicate For successfully setting the zero-offset, it is recommended that the left crank arm with power meter is positioned straight down (6 o’clock position), with no load applied to the pedal, and the bike in a stable position
The power meter\'s slope can be found on the lid on the back of the power meter (e.g. 24.5 Hz/Nm). It is recommended setting it as well on every power meter, but not obligatory
You are now ready to set the zero-offset of the power meters by pressing the \'ENABLE AUTO-ZERO\' button Set CTF Slope Request Manual Calibration Set power meters slopes Not provided Last known calibration messages for running power meters
